be.sizingservers.vapus.agent
Class Monitor

java.lang.Object
  be.sizingservers.vapus.agent.Monitor

public abstract class Monitor
extends java.lang.Object

Extend your own monitor implementation from this. A constructor must be present calling super(server, socket, id).

Field Summary
protected static java.lang.String config
          Should only be written to in the setConfig() implementation.
protected  java.util.Timer poller
          Use this to periodically (according to the vApus-agent.properties) poll and send wiw with counters.
protected  boolean running
          Set to true when started and to false when stopped.
protected  Server server
          The server that created this monitor.
protected  java.net.Socket socket
          A monitor is always linked to a socket.
protected static java.lang.String wdyh
          Should only be written to in the setWDYH() implementation.
protected static be.sizingservers.vapus.agent.util.Entities wdyhEntities
          Should only be written to in the setWDYH() implementation.

abstract  void start()
          Start the monitor and send counters periodically using super.server.send(String line, super.Socket) DO NOT FORGET TO SET ENTITIES.TIMESTAMP!

clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Field Detail

config

protected static volatile java.lang.String config
Should only be written to in the setConfig() implementation. And only once, when the agent starts.

wdyh

protected static volatile java.lang.String wdyh
Should only be written to in the setWDYH() implementation. And only once, when the agent starts.

wdyhEntities

protected static volatile be.sizingservers.vapus.agent.util.Entities wdyhEntities
Should only be written to in the setWDYH() implementation. And only once, when the agent starts.

server

protected Server server
The server that created this monitor. There should only be one server in an agent.

socket

protected java.net.Socket socket
A monitor is always linked to a socket.

running

protected boolean running
Set to true when started and to false when stopped. This can be used as a check to for not trying to start the monitor twice.

poller

protected java.util.Timer poller
Use this to periodically (according to the vApus-agent.properties) poll and send wiw with counters.

Constructor Detail

Monitor

public Monitor()
A empty instance only to be used to call getConfig() and getWDYH(). You must do the needed init stuff here.

Monitor

public Monitor(Server server,
               java.net.Socket socket,
               long id)
Parameters:
server -
socket - Monitor should always be used in Server. The connection that uses this monitor is used for when new data is available. Then it is send to the client.
id -
Method Detail

setConfig

public abstract void setConfig()
Sets the hardware configuration. This must be in XML. (lshw -xml output for instance). It may not contain line breaks, but if so these will be trimmed for you. This will be called automatically for you when you call the getter.

setWDYH

public abstract void setWDYH()
Gets the headers and subheaders that can be monitored into one or more Entity objects (Ex: a machine). This will be called automatically for you when you call the getter.

start

public abstract void start()
Start the monitor and send counters periodically using super.server.send(String line, super.Socket) DO NOT FORGET TO SET ENTITIES.TIMESTAMP!

stop

public abstract void stop()
Do not forget to cleanup sources.

getWDYHEntities

public static be.sizingservers.vapus.agent.util.Entities getWDYHEntities()
If is null: parsed from wdyh is that is not null.

Returns:
wdyh entities

getId

public long getId()
Returns:
The unique id for this monitor.

getConfig

public static java.lang.String getConfig()
Gets the hardware configuration.

Returns:
config

getWDYH

public static java.lang.String getWDYH()
Get what do you have. If is null: parsed from wdyhEntities is that is not null.

Returns:
wdyh

cleanupConfigAndWDYH

public static void cleanupConfigAndWDYH()
Removes line breaks.

getWIW

public java.lang.String getWIW()
Get what I want

Returns:
wdyh if wiw is null.

setWIW

public void setWIW(java.lang.String wiw)
Set what I want.

Parameters:
wiw - Should be formatted the same as wdyh.

public be.sizingservers.vapus.agent.util.Entities getWIWEntities()

what I want entities
